title: Calories in Vegetable Beef Soup
meta_description: Discover calories in vegetable beef soup per cup, including protein, carbs, fat, sodium details, and easy tweaks for your bowl.
assumptions: Canned, ready-to-eat vegetable beef soup with beef chunks, carrots, potatoes, peas, and broth; about 245 g per serving.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe, ingredients, and preparation method. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One cup of vegetable beef soup typically contains about 85 kcal and 6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of vegetable beef soup?
Is vegetable beef soup high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, typically around 800 mg sodium per cup due to broth and canning.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in vegetable beef soup?
faqs.a: Roughly 6 g protein per cup from the beef.

faqs.q: Are there many carbs in vegetable beef soup?
faqs.a: About 10 g carbs per cup, mostly from vegetables like potatoes and carrots.

faqs.q: How does homemade vegetable beef soup compare calorie-wise?
faqs.a: Homemade versions can be lower (60-80 kcal per cup) if using lean beef and less salt.
